1.q_string:
Consider the following reaction approaching equilibrium at \(27^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\) and \(1 \mathrm{~atm}\) pressure
\(\begin{aligned} & K_f=10^3 \\ & \mathrm{~A}+\mathrm{B} \rightleftharpoons \mathrm{C}+\mathrm{D} \\ & \mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{r}}=10^2 \\ & \end{aligned}\)
The standard Gibb's energy change \(\left(\Delta_{\mathrm{r}} G^{\circ}\right)\) at \(27^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\) is (-)_______________ \(\mathrm{kJ} \mathrm{mol}^{-1}\) (Nearest integer).
(Given : \(\mathrm{R}=8.3 \mathrm{JK}^{-1} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}\) and \(\ln 10=2.3\) ) [29-Jan-2023 Shift 1]

q_option: Both \(A\) and \(R\) are true and \(R\) is the correct explanation of \(\mathrm{A}\).
Both \(A\) and \(R\) are true but \(R\) is NOT the correct explanation of \(\mathrm{A}\).
1.q_string:
Given below are two statements one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R:

Assertion A: The amphoteric nature of water is explained by using Lewis acid/base concept

Reason R: Water acts as an acid with \(\mathrm{NH} 3\) and as a base with \(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{~S}\).

In the light of the above statements choose the correct answer from the options given below: [JEE (Main)-2022]

A student needs to prepare a buffer solution of propanoic acid and its sodium salt with pH 4.

The ratio of \(\frac{\left[\mathrm{CH}_3 \mathrm{CH}_2 \mathrm{COO}^{-}\right]}{\left[\mathrm{CH}_3 \mathrm{CH}_2 \mathrm{COOH}\right]}\) required to make buffer is______________. [JEE (Main)-2022]

Given : \(\mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{a}}\left(\mathrm{CH}_3 \mathrm{CH}_2 \mathrm{COOH}\right)=1.3 \times 10^{-5}\)

\(20 \mathrm{~mL}\) of \(0.1 \mathrm{M} \mathrm{NH}_4 \mathrm{OH}\) is mixed with \(40 \mathrm{~mL}\) of \(0.05 \mathrm{M} \mathrm{HCl}\). The \(\mathrm{pH}\) of the mixture is nearest to

(Given : \(\mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{b}}\left(\mathrm{NH}_4 \mathrm{OH}\right)=1 \times 10^{-5}, \log 2=0.30, \log 3=\\(0.48, \log 5=0.69, \log 7=0.84, \log 11=1.04)\) [JEE (Main)-2022]

Class XII students were asked to prepare one litre of buffer solution of \(\mathrm{pH} 8.26\) by their Chemistry teacher. The amount of ammonium chloride to be dissolved by the student in \(0.2 \mathrm{M}\) ammonia solution to make one litre of the buffer is (Given : \(\mathrm{pK}_{\mathrm{b}}\left(\mathrm{NH}_3\right)=4.74\), Molar mass of \(\mathrm{NH}_3=17 \mathrm{~g}\) \(\mathrm{mol}^{-1}\), Molar mass of \(\mathrm{NH}_4 \mathrm{Cl}=53.5 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}\) ) [JEE (Main)-2022]

\(\mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{a}_1}, \mathrm{~K}_{\mathrm{a}_2}\) and \(\mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{a}_3}\) are the respective ionization constants for the following reactions (a), (b) and (c).

(a) \(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{C}_2 \mathrm{O}_4 \rightleftharpoons \mathrm{H}^{+}+\mathrm{HC}_2 \mathrm{O}_4^{-}\)

(b) \(\mathrm{HC}_2 \mathrm{O}_4^{-} \rightleftharpoons \mathrm{H}^{+}+\mathrm{C}_2 \mathrm{O}_4^{2-}\)

(c) \(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{C}_2 \mathrm{O}_4 \rightleftharpoons 2 \mathrm{H}^{+}+\mathrm{C}_2 \mathrm{O}_4^{2-}\)

The relationship between \(\mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{a}_1}, \mathrm{~K}_{\mathrm{a}_2}\) and \(\mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{a}_3}\) is given as [JEE (Main)-2022]

At \(298 \mathrm{~K}\)

\(\mathrm{N}_2(\mathrm{~g})+3 \mathrm{H}_2(\mathrm{~g}) \rightleftharpoons 2 \mathrm{NH}_3(\mathrm{~g}), \mathrm{K}_1=4 \times 10^5\)

\(\mathrm{~N}_2(\mathrm{~g})+\mathrm{O}_2(\mathrm{~g}) \rightleftharpoons 2 \mathrm{NO}(\mathrm{g}), \mathrm{K}_2=1.6 \times 10^{12} \)

\(\mathrm{H}_2(\mathrm{~g})+\frac{1}{2} \mathrm{O}_2(\mathrm{~g}) \rightleftharpoons \mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}(\mathrm{g}), \mathrm{K}_3=1.0 \times 10^{-13}\)

Based on above equilibria, the equilibrium constant of the reaction,

\(2 \mathrm{NH}_3(\mathrm{~g})+\frac{5}{2} \mathrm{O}_2(\mathrm{~g}) \rightleftharpoons 2 \mathrm{NO}(\mathrm{g})+3 \mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}(\mathrm{g})\) is \(\times 10^{-33}\)

(Nearest integer) [29-Jan-2023 Shift 2]

At \(25^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\), the enthalpy of the following processes are given:

\(\mathrm{H}_2(\mathrm{~g})+\mathrm{O}_2(\mathrm{~g}) \rightarrow 2 \mathrm{OH}(\mathrm{g}) \Delta \mathrm{H}^0=78 \mathrm{~kJ} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}\)

\(\mathrm{H}_2(\mathrm{~g})+1 / 2 \mathrm{O}_2(\mathrm{~g}) \rightarrow \mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}(\mathrm{g}) \Delta \mathrm{H}^0=-242 \mathrm{~kJ} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}\)

\(\mathrm{H}_2(\mathrm{~g}) \rightarrow 2 \mathrm{H}(\mathrm{g}) \Delta \mathrm{H}^0=436 \mathrm{~kJ} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}\)

\(1 / 2 \mathrm{O}_2(\mathrm{~g}) \rightarrow \mathrm{O}(\mathrm{g}) \Delta \mathrm{H}^0=249 \mathrm{~kJ} \mathrm{~mol}^{-1}\)

What would be the value of \(\mathrm{X}\) for the following reaction?_________(Nearest integer)

\(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}(\mathrm{g}) \rightarrow \mathrm{H}(\mathrm{g})+\mathrm{OH}(\mathrm{g}) \Delta \mathrm{H}^{\circ}=\mathrm{XkJ} \mathrm{mol}^{-1}\) [1-Feb-2023]
When the hydrogen ion concentration \(\left[\mathrm{H}^{+}\right]\)changes by a factor of 1000 , the value of \(\mathrm{pH}\) of the solution_____________________. [25-Jan-2023]

(i) \(\mathrm{X}(\mathrm{g}) \rightleftharpoons \mathrm{Y}(\mathrm{g})+\mathrm{Z}(\mathrm{g}) \mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{p} 1}=3\)

(ii) \(\mathrm{A}(\mathrm{g}) \rightleftharpoons 2 \mathrm{~B}(\mathrm{~g}) \mathrm{K}_{\mathrm{p} 2}=1\)

If the degree of dissociation and initial concentration of both the reactants \(X(\mathrm{~g})\) and \(\mathrm{A}(\mathrm{g})\) are equal, then the ratio of the total pressure at equilibrium \(\left(\frac{p_1}{p_2}\right)\) is equal to \(x: 1\). The value of \(x\) is _______________________ (Nearest integer) [1-Feb-2023]

q_option: \(\mathrm{AgCl}\) precipitates first because its \(K_{s p}\) is high.
\(\mathrm{Ag}_2 \mathrm{CrO}_4\) precipitates first as its \(K_{s p}\) is low.
\(\mathrm{Ag}_2 \mathrm{CrO}_4\) precipitates first because the amount of \(\mathrm{Ag}^{+}\)needed is low.
\(\mathrm{AgCl}\) will precipitate first as the amount of \(\mathrm{Ag}^{+}\)needed to precipitate is low.
1.q_string:
A solution is \(0.1 \mathrm{M}\) in \(\mathrm{Cl}^{-}\)and \(0.001 \mathrm{M}^{-1} \mathrm{CrO}_4{ }^{2-}\).

Solid \(\mathrm{AgNO}_3\) is gradually added to it Assuming that the addition does not change in volume and \(K_{\text {sp }}(\mathrm{AgCl})=1.7 \times 10^{-10} \mathrm{M}^2\) and \(K_{s p}\left(\mathrm{Ag}_2 \mathrm{CrO}_4\right)=1.9 \times 10^{-12} \mathrm{M}^3\)

Select correct statement from the following: [20 Jul 2021 Shift 2]
The solubility of \(\mathrm{Ca}(\mathrm{OH})_2\) in water is [Given: The solubility product of \(\mathrm{Ca}(\mathrm{OH})_2\) in water \(\left.=5.5 \times 10^{-6}\right]\) [25 Feb 2021]

q_option: Both \(A\) and \(R\) are true but \(R\) is not the correct explanation of A.
Both \(A\) and \(R\) are true and \(R\) is the correct explanation of \(A\)
1.q_string:
Given below are two statements: One is labelled as Assertion A and the other labelled as Reason R.

Assertion A During the boiling of water having temporary hardness, \(\mathrm{Mg}\left(\mathrm{HCO}_3\right)_2\) is converted to \(\mathrm{MgCO}_3\).

Reason \(\mathrm{R}\) The solubility product of \(\mathrm{Mg}(\mathrm{OH})_2\) is greater than that of \(\mathrm{MgCO}_3\).

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below [18 Mar 2021]

The solubility of \(\mathrm{AgCN}\) in a buffer solution of \(p H=3\) is \(x\). The value of \(x\) is______________.

[Assume : No cyano complex is formed; \(K_{s p}(\mathrm{AgCN})=2.2 \times 10^{-16}\) and \(\left.K_a(H C N)=6.2 \times 10^{-10}\right]\)

[25 Feb 2021]

For the reaction

\(\mathrm{Fe}_2 \mathrm{~N}(\mathrm{~s})+\frac{3}{2} \mathrm{H}_2(\mathrm{~g}) \rightleftharpoons 2 \mathrm{Fe}(\mathrm{s})+\mathrm{NH}_3(\mathrm{~g})\)

[Sep. 06,2020]
In the figure shown below reactant \(A\) (represented by square) is in cquilibrium with product \(B\) (represented by circle). The equilibrium constant is: [Jan. 09, 2020]

If the equilibrium constant for \(A \rightleftharpoons B+C\) is \(K_{e q}{ }^{(1)}\) and that of \(B+C \rightleftharpoons P\) is \(K_{e q}{ }^{(2)}\), the equilibrium constant for \(A \rightleftharpoons P\) is: [Sep. 04,2020]

Assuming that \(\mathrm{Ba}(\mathrm{OH})_2\) is completely ionised in aqueous solution under the given conditions the concentration of \(\mathrm{H}_3 \mathrm{O}^{+}\)ions in \(0.005 \mathrm{M}\) aqueous solution of \(\mathrm{Ba}(\mathrm{OH})_2\) at \(298 \mathrm{~K}\) is __________ \(\times 10^{-12} \mathrm{~mol} \mathrm{~L}^{-1}\). (Nearest integer) [25 Jul 2021]

The oxygen dissolved in water exerts a partial pressure of \(20 \mathrm{kPa}\) in the vapour above water. The molar solubility of oxygen in water is__________\(\times 10^{-5} \mathrm{~mol} \mathrm{dm}^{-3}\). (Round off to the nearest integer).

[Given, Henry's law constant \(\left(K_H\right)=8.0 \times 10^4 \mathrm{kPa}\) for \(O_2\), density of water with dissolved oxygen \(=1.0 \mathrm{kgdm}^{-3} \mathrm{~J}\). [17 Mar 2021]

The value of \(K c\) is 64 at \(800 K\) for the reaction

\(\mathrm{N}_2(\mathrm{~g})+3 \mathrm{H}_2(\mathrm{~g}) \rightleftharpoons 2 \mathrm{NH}_3(\mathrm{~g}) \text {. }\)

The value of \(K_c\) for the following reaction is:

\(\mathrm{NH}_3(\mathrm{~g}) \rightleftharpoons \frac{1}{2} \mathrm{~N}_2(\mathrm{~g})+\frac{3}{2} \mathrm{H}_2(\mathrm{~g})\)

[Sep. 06, 2020]

q_option: Both assertion and reason are true, and the reason is the correct explanation for the assertion.
Both assertion and reason are true, but the reason is not the correct explanation for the assertion.
Assertion is not true, but reason is true.
1.q_string:
For the following Assertion and Reason, the correct option is: [Jan.08,2020]

Assertion: The \(\mathrm{pH}\) of water increases with increase in temperature.

Reason: The dissociation of water into \(\mathrm{H}^{+}\)and \(\mathrm{OH}^{-}\)is an exothermic reaction.

0.01 moles of a weak acid \(H A\left(K_a=2.0 \times 10^{-6}\right)\) is dissolved in \(1.0 \mathrm{~L}\) of \(0.1 \mathrm{MHCl}\) solution. The degree of dissociation of \(H A\) is ...... \(\times 10^{-5}\) (Round off to the nearest integer). [Neglect volume change on adding HA. Assume degree of dissociation \(\ll<1\) ] [17 Mar 2021]

The molar solubility of \(\mathrm{Zn}(\mathrm{OH})_2\) in \(0.1 \mathrm{M} \mathrm{NaOH}\) solution is \(x \times 10^{-18} \mathrm{M}\). The value of \(x\) is (Nearest integer)

(Given; The solubility product of \(\mathrm{Zn}(\mathrm{OH})_2\) is \(2 \times 10^{-20}\) ).

\(T_2=100^{\circ} \mathrm{C} K_2=100\)

1.q_string:
For the following Assertion and Reason, the correct option is : [Sep. 02,2020] 

Assertion (A): When Cu (II) and sulphide ions are mixed, they react together extremely quickly to give a solid.

Reason (R): The equilibrium constant of \(\mathrm{Cu}^{2+}(a q)+S^{2-}(\mathrm{aq})\) \(\rightleftharpoons C u S(s)\) is high because the solubility product is low.

Arrange the following solutions in the decreasing order of \(\mathrm{pOH}\) : [Sep. 06, 2020]

(A) \(0.01 \mathrm{M} \mathrm{H} \mathrm{Cl}\) 

(B) \(0.01 \mathrm{MNaOH}\)

(C) \(0.01 \mathrm{MCH}_3 \mathrm{COONa}\)

(D) \(0.01 \mathrm{MNaCl}\)

Consider the following reaction:

\(\mathrm{N}_2 \mathrm{O}_4(\mathrm{~g}) \rightleftharpoons 2 \mathrm{NO}_2(\mathrm{~g}) ; \Delta \mathrm{H}^0=+58 \mathrm{~kJ}\)

For each of the following cases i), (ii, the direction in which the equilibrium shifts is:

(i) Temperature is decreases

(ii) Pressure is increased by adding \(N_2\) at constant \(T\).

[Sep .05,2020]

The value of \(a\) is _______________(Integer answer)

The solubility of \(\mathrm{CdSO}_4\) in water is \(8.0 \times 10^{-4} \mathrm{~mol} \mathrm{~L}^{-1}\). Its solubility in \(0.01 \mathrm{M} \mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{SO}_4\) solution is \(\times 10^{-6} \mathrm{~mol} \mathrm{~L}^{-1}\). (Round off to the nearest integer) (Assume that, solubility is much less than \(0.01 \mathrm{M}\) ) [18 Mar 2021]
